SENT.plain: We report on two patients with transient abnormalities on MRI during status epilepticus(SE)
Diffusion-weighted MR imaging(DWI) and T2-weighted and fluid-attenuated inversion recovery (FLAIR) MR images showed cortical and thalamic hyperintensity with swelling of the cortex
The lesions did not respect vascular territories
We also observed an increased signal in the ipsilateral middle cerebral artery on magnetic resonance angiography(MRA), and leptomeningeal enhancement on postcontrast MRI
Follow-up imaging revealed that the abnormal findings resolved within a few weeks, although a residual area of increased T2 signal intensity persisted
These findings suggest the presence of reversible cytotoxic and vasogenic edema induced by seizure
We conclude that this disorder should be taken into consideration in the differential diagnosis of other conditions, including ischemic stroke
